1.text: Now Sarai the wife of Abram, had brought forth no children; having a handmaid, an Egyptian, named Agar,

2.text: She said to her husband: Behold, the Lord hath restrained me from bearing: go in unto my handmaid, it may be I may have children of her at least. And when he agreed to her request,

3.text: She took Agar the Egyptian her handmaid, ten years after they first dwelt in the land of Chanaan, and gave her to her husband to wife.

4.text: And he went in to her. But she, perceiving that she was with child, despised her mistress.

5.text: And Sarai said to Abram: Thou dost unjustly with me: I gave my handmaid into thy bosom, and she perceiving herself to be with child, despiseth me. The Lord judge between me and thee.

6.text: And Abram made answer, and said to her: Behold thy handmaid is in thy own hand, use her its it pleaseth thee. And when Sarai afflicted her, she ran away.

7.text: And the angel of the Lord having found her, by a fountain of water in the wilderness, which is in the way to Sur in the desert,

8.text: He said to her: Agar, handmaid of Sarai, whence comest thou? and whither goest thou? And she answered: I flee from the face of Sarai, my mistress.

9.text: And the angel of the Lord said to her: Return to thy mistress, and humble thyself under her hand.

10.text: And again he said: I will multiply thy seed exceedingly, and it shall not be numbered for multitude.

11.text: And again: Behold, said he, thou art with child, and thou shalt bring forth a son: and thou shalt call his name Ismael, because the Lord hath heard thy affliction.

12.text: He shall be a wild man: his hand will be against all men, and all menâ€™s hands against him: and he shall pitch his tents over against all his brethren.

13.text: And she called the name of the Lord that spoke unto her: Thou the God who hast seen me. For she said: Verily here have I seen the hinder parts of him that seeth me.

14.text: Therefore she called that well, The well of him that liveth and seeth me. The same is between Cades and Bared.

15.text: And Agar brought forth a son to Abram: who called his name Ismael.

16.text: Abram was fourscore and six years old when Agar brought him forth Ismael.
